item.title: Falcom to release unannounced PS5 port in 2025 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/falcom-to-release-unannounced-ps5-port-in-2025-in-japan

  • PS5

Plus an updated list of Falcom's in-development titles.

Falcom will release an unannounced ported title for PlayStation 5 in 2025 in Japan, according to the release schedule in its “Matters Concerning Business Plans and Growth Potential” investor presentation published via Nikkei today.

This is in addition to its already announced 2025 titles Ys X: Proud Nordics, Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter, and a “Nintendo Switch title,” which should be the Switch version of Ys: Memories of Celceta.

Falcom also shared an updated list of recently released and upcoming titles:

  • [Title A] The Legend of Heroes: Kai no Kiseki – Farewell, O Zemuria (PS5, PS4) – Released September 2024
  • [Title B] Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter (PS5, Switch, PC) – In Development
  • [Title C] Tokyo Xanadu New Project (TBA) – In Development
  • [Title D] Unannounced Title (TBA) – In Development
  • Unannounced PlayStation 5 Ported Title (PS5) – In Development
  • The Legend of Heroes: Trails through Daybreak (Switch) – Released February 2024
  • [Title E] The Legend of Heroes: Trails through Daybreak II (Switch) – Released July 2024
  • [Title F] Ys Memoire: The Oath in Felghana Port (PS5, PS4) – Released May 2024
  • [Title G] Unannounced Nintendo Switch Title (Switch) – In Development
    • Editor’s Note: This should be Ys: Memories of Celceta, which was revealed as coming in spring 2025 in Japan at Falcom’s recent investors meeting. Although this is not labeled as a port, the Switch versions of The Legend of Heroes: Trails through Daybreak and The Legend of Heroes: Trails through Daybreak II are also not labeled as ports.
  • Ys X: Proud Nordics (TBA) – In Development
  • [Title H] Unannounced Trails Series Title (TBA) – In Development
  • [Title I] Unannounced Ys Series Title (TBA) – In Development

Falcom said that while it currently releases two or three new titles a year, excluding budget price re-releases, its goal is to increase the number of titles it releases per year to four to five titles within the next two years.

item.title: The Legend of Heroes: Kai no Kiseki – Farewell, O Zemuria coming to PC in Asia in 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/the-legend-of-heroes-kai-no-kiseki-farewell-o-zemuria-coming-to-pc-in-asia-in-2025

  • PC

Featuring 21:9 ultra-wide monitor support and omre.

Publisher Clouded Leopard Entertainment and developer Falcom will release The Legend of Heroes: Kai no Kiseki – Farewell, O Zemuria for PC via Steam in 2025, the companies announced. It will support Japanese audio, with Korean, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese subtitles.

The Legend of Heroes: Kai no Kiseki – Farewell, O Zemuria first launched for PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4 on September 26, 2024 in Japan and Asia.

Here is an overview of the PC version and game, via Clouded Leopard Entertainment:

■ About the Steam Version

Engine Powered by DirectX 12

With a DirectX 12-based engine, The Legend of Heroes: Kai no Kiseki – Farewell, O Zemuria offers enhanced performance and cutting-edge AI-powered upscaling technologies (Intel XeSS, NVIDIA DLSS, AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution). These advancements ensure improved frame rates while maintaining stunning visuals, allowing players to experience the beautiful world of The Legend of Heroes: Kai no Kiseki – Farewell, O Zemuria with greater clarity and comfort.

Exclusive Features for the Steam Version!

The Steam version supports 21:9 ultra-wide monitors and the Steam Deck’s 16:10 display, enabling gameplay at 4K resolution and frame rates exceeding 60 frames per second*. Enjoy a broader field of view and smoother motion for an elevated gaming experience.

*Note: Resolutions and frame rates unsupported by your monitor will not appear in the settings list.

Options like switching between windowed and full-screen modes, adjusting rendering resolution, and configuring aspect ratios can all be customized directly from the in-game settings menu. Additionally, the game’s user interface supports mouse input for actions like menu navigation and item selection, ensuring a seamless experience when playing with a keyboard and mouse.

Simplified Chinese Subtitles Added!

To make the game accessible to even more players, Simplified Chinese has been added as a subtitle language option.

  • ❮
  • ❯

■ About The Legend of Heroes: Kai no Kiseki – Farewell, O Zemuria

“In the year 120X, everything comes to an end.”

C. Epstein, the father of the orbal revolution, prophesized the end of the Zemurian continent.

As “X Day” approaches, a massive orbal rocket is about to be launched from a large military base built in the Kunlun Range.

“Can man make it past the planet’s atmosphere?”
“What lies at the end of the continent?”
“Will mankind be able to uncover the true nature of the ‘world’?”

While the whole world watches to witness the largest undertaking since the dawn of history, somewhere in the singularity that is Ored, forces from all over the land were about to gather, including a young “Spriggan.”

Will the single trail toward the distant heavens ultimately shape the future of Zemuria, or…

item.title: Infinity Nikki version 1.1 update ‘Shooting Star Season’ launches December 30
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/infinity-nikki-version-1-1-update-shooting-star-season-launches-december-30

  • PS5
  • Smartphone

New storylines, platforming challenges, outfits, and omre.

Infinity Nikki‘s first major update, “Shooting Star Season,” will launch on December 30, publisher Infold Games and developer Papergame announced. It will add new storylines, platforming challenges, time-limited events, and outfits.

Here is an overview of the update, via Infold Games:

Infinity Nikki‘s first major update, “Shooting Star Season,” available December 30 through January 23, introduces new storylines, platforming challenges, time-limited events, and of course, stunning outfits to ring in the new year.

During the Shooting Star Season, shimmering meteors will grace the night skies over Miraland as residents come together and cast their wishes upon the stars. Beyond these cosmic travelers and festive decorations, players will find a series of new activities, rewards, and ways to interact with the cozy open-world.

With over 20 million downloads since launch, Infinity Nikki has received critical acclaim since releasing earlier this month. Designed with care to provide a unique and immersive experience, Infinity Nikki blends dress-up gameplay with engaging activities such as fishing, crafting, and story-driven quests. A colorful cast of characters and breathtaking locations make Miraland a truly unforgettable place to explore. Players have discovered a cozy, whimsical open-world adventure where fashion meets exploration. Whether gliding across stunning landscapes, solving puzzles, grooming adorable pets, or uncovering hidden secrets like ghost trains and soaring paper cranes, Infinity Nikki offers endless charm and surprises for players to enjoy.

Infinity Nikki is available now for PlayStation 5, PC via client download and Epic Games Store, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play.
